para.text: Drawings.
Except for multi-jurisdictional games, monitor games, and raffles, draw game drawings shall be open to the public and shall occur at least once a week.
The Agency may use members of the general public as witnesses at a draw game drawing.
Winning numbers for a draw game may be drawn by:
Mechanical drawing equipment;
A random number generator; or
Another random method or device approved by the Director.
The numbers drawn for a game shall be the winning numbers for that drawing of that game.
Draw Game Tickets.
A draw game ticket shall be generated through the use of a terminal or a subscription purchase.
The draw game ticket shall include the:
Numbers played;
Amount wagered;
Ticket serial number;
Barcode with an encoded serial number and data to permit scanning of the ticket; and
Drawing date or, if the ticket is for multiple drawings, the range of drawing dates or draws.
Monitor Games.
The results of a monitor game drawing may be displayed on the game’s monitor.
A retailer may require use of a playslip or an ePlayslip for monitor games.
Consumer Game Information.
The Agency shall provide information about:
Draw games; and
Multi-jurisdictional games with draw game tickets.
As determined by the Agency, consumer game information shall explain the:
Game;
Game play; and
Play of optional features.
The Agency may provide consumer game information on its website or in any other location, as determined by the Agency.
To determine if a draw game ticket is a winning ticket, a player may present the ticket to a retailer, a PAT, or the Agency.
Fast Play Game Tickets.
A Fast Play game ticket shall be generated through the use of a terminal.
The Fast Play game ticket shall include the:
Graphic rendering of symbols or numbers that allow for visual inspection to determine if the ticket is entitled to a prize;
Amount played;
Ticket serial number;
Barcode with an encoded serial number and data to permit scanning of the ticket; and
Date and time of sale.
Consumer Game Information.
The Agency shall provide information about Fast Play games.
As determined by the Agency, consumer game information shall explain the:
Game;
Game play; and
Play of any optional features.
The Agency may provide consumer game information on its website or in any other location.
To determine if a Fast Play game ticket is a winning ticket, a player may present the ticket to a retailer, a PAT, or the Agency.
An instant game ticket shall have one or more areas that conceal:
The playing area or a portion of the playing area;
The prize or prizes;
Other information as determined by the Director; or
Any of the above.
To determine if an instant ticket is a winning ticket, a player may:
Expose the concealed area or areas in accordance with the game instructions on the instant ticket; or
Present the ticket to a retailer, PAT, or the Agency.
The Agency may offer bonus games, promotional games, or both.
A bonus game may be:
A lottery game;
A promotional game; or
Both.
A promotional game may be a bonus game.
For claiming period purposes, instant ticket games are designated as bonus games or drawings.
